chapterTitle: Financial Leverage and Capital Structure Policy

columns.text:
$a)$ First, we have to find out the net income of nominal condition post-tax  which we denote with $NIN$, where the earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$29,000$ and the tax rate $TR$ is $21\%$

$$\begin{align*} NIN&=EI\times (1-TR)\\[7pt] &=29,000\times (1-21\%)\\[7pt]
&=29,000\times 1-0.21\\[7pt]
&=29,000\times 0.79\\[7pt] &=\$22,910 \end{align*}$$

 

So, the net income of nominal condition post tax is $\boxed{\$22,910}$

We have to find out the net income of expansion condition post-tax  which we denote with $NIE$, where the earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$29,000$, increase $I$ is $30\%$ and the tax rate $TR$ is $21\%$

$$\begin{align*} NIE&=EI\times (1+I)\times (1-TR)\\[7pt] &=29,000\times (1+30\%)\times (1-21\%)\\[7pt]
&=29,000\times(1+0.3) \times (1-0.21)\\[7pt]
&=29,000\times 1.3 \times 0.79\\[7pt] &=\$29,783 \end{align*}$$

 

So, the net income of expansion condition post tax is $\boxed{\$29,783}$

we have to find out the net income of recession condition post-tax  which we denote with $NIR$, where the earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$29,000$, decrease $D$ is $40\%$ and the tax rate $TR$ is $21\%$

$$\begin{align*} NIR&=EI\times (1-D)\times (1-TR)\\[7pt] &=29,000\times (1-40\%)\times (1-21\%)\\[7pt]
&=29,000\times(1-0.4) \times (1-0.21)\\[7pt]
&=29,000\times 0.6 \times 0.79\\[7pt] &=\$13,746 \end{align*}$$

 

So, the net income of recession condition post-tax is $\boxed{\$13,746}$

We have to find out the earnings per share of normal economic condition  which we denote with $EPN$, where the net income of nominal condition post-tax $NIN$ is $\$22,910$ and the currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$

$$\begin{align*} EPN&=\frac{NIN}{CS}\\[12pt] &=\frac{22,910}{7,400}\\[12pt] &=3.09 \end{align*}$$
So, the earnings per share of nominal economic are $\boxed{3.09}$ 

​

We have to find out the earnings per share of expansion economic condition  which we denote with $EPE$, where the net income of expansion condition post-tax $NIE$ is $\$29,783$ and the currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$

$$\begin{align*} EPE&=\frac{NIE}{CS}\\[12pt] &=\frac{29,783}{7,400}\\[12pt] &=4.02 \end{align*}$$
So, the earnings per share of expansion economic are $\boxed{4.02}$

We have to find out the earnings per share of recession economic condition  which we denote with $EPR$, where the net income of recession condition post-tax $NIR$ is $\$13,746$ and the currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$

$$\begin{align*} EPR&=\frac{NIR}{CS}\\[12pt] &=\frac{13,746}{7,400}\\[12pt] &=1.85 \end{align*}$$
So, the earnings per share of recession economic are $\boxed{1.85}$

We have to find out the actual percentage change in earnings per share of nominal to expansion which we denote with $PE$, where the earnings per share of expansion economic $EE$ is $4.02$, and the earnings per share of nominal economic are $EP$ is $3.09$

$$\begin{align*} PE&=\frac{EE-EP}{EP}\\[12pt] &=\frac{4.02-3.09}{3.09}\\[12pt] &=\frac{0.93}{3.09}\\[12pt] &=0.3009\\[7pt] &=30.09\% \end{align*}$$

So, the actual percentage change in earnings per share is $\boxed{30.09\%}$
​

We have to find out the actual percentage change in earnings per share of nominal to the recession which we denote with $PR$, where the earnings per share of recession economic $ER$ is $1.86$, and the earnings per share of nominal economic are $EP$ is $3.09$

$$\begin{align*} PR&=\frac{ER-EP}{EP}\\[12pt] &=\frac{1.86-3.09}{3.09}\\[12pt] &=\frac{-1.23}{3.09}\\[12pt] &=-0.3980\\[7pt] &=39.80\% \end{align*}$$

So, the actual percentage change in earnings per share is $\boxed{39.80\%}$
​

$b)$ Second, we have to find out the actual price per share which we denote with $AP$, where the total market value $TV$ is $185,000$ and the currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$

$$\begin{align*} AP&=\frac{TV}{CS}\\[12pt] &=\frac{185,000}{7,400}\\[12pt] &=\$25 \end{align*}$$
 

So, the actual price per share is $\boxed{\$25}$
​

We have to find out the actual shares repurchased which we denote with $ASR$, where the debt issue $D$ is $65,000$ and the actual price per share $AP$ is $\$25$

$$\begin{align*} ASR&=\frac{D}{AP}\\[12pt] &=\frac{65,000}{25}\\[12pt] &=2,600 \end{align*}$$

So, the actual shares repurchased is $\boxed{2,600}$

We have to find out the interest expenses which we denote with $IE$, where the interest rate $IR$ is $7\%$ and the debt issue $D$ is $65,000$


$$\begin{align*} IE&=IR \times D\\[7pt] &=7\%\times 65,000\\[7pt] &=0.07 \times 65,000\\[7pt] &=4,550 \end{align*}$$

So, the interest expenses is $\boxed{\$4,550}$
​

We have to find out the net income of nominal condition which we denote with $NIN$, where the earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$29,000$, interest expenses $IE$ is $\$4,550$ and the tax rate $TR$ is $21\%$

$$\begin{align*} NIN&=EI-IE \times (1-TR)\\[7pt] &=29,000-4,550 \times (1-21\%)\\[7pt]&=29,000-4,550 \times (1-0.21)\\[7pt]&=24450\times0.79\\[7pt] &=\$19,315.5 \end{align*}$$

So, the net income of nominal condition is $\boxed{\$19,315.5}$
​

We have to find out the net income of expansion condition which we denote with $NIE$, where the earnings before interest and taxes expansion $EI$ is $\$37,700$, interest expenses $IE$ is $\$4,550$ and the tax rate $TR$ is $21\%$

$$\begin{align*} NIE&=EI-IE \times (1-TR)\\[7pt] &=37,700-4,550 \times (1-21\%)\\[7pt]&=37,700-4,550 \times (1-0.21)\\[7pt]&=33150\times0.79\\[7pt] &=\$26,188.5 \end{align*}$$

So, the net income of expansion condition is $\boxed{\$26,188.5}$
​

We have to find out the net income of recession condition which we denote with $NIR$, where the earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$17,400$ and the interest expenses $IE$ is $\$4,550$

$$\begin{align*} NIR&=EI-IE \times (1-TR)\\[7pt] &=17,400-4,550 \times (1-21\%)\\[7pt]&=17,400-4,550 \times (1-0.21)\\[7pt]&=12,850\times0.79\\[7pt] &=\$10,151.5 \end{align*}$$

So, the net income of recession condition is $\boxed{\$10,151.5}$

We have to find out the earnings per share under the nominal economic condition which we denote with $EN$, where the net income of nominal condition $NIN$ is $\$19,315.5$, currently outstanding shares CSCS is $7,400$ and the actual shares repurchased $ASR$ is $2,600$

$$\begin{align*} EN&=\frac{NIN}{CS-ASR}\\[12pt] &=\frac{19,315.5}{7,400-2,600}\\[12pt] &=\frac{19,315.5}{4,800}\\[12pt] &=4.02 \end{align*}$$

So, the earnings per share under the nominal economic condition is $\boxed{\$4.02}$

We have to find out the earnings per share under the expansion economic condition which we denote with $EE$, where the net income of expansion condition $NIE$ is $\$26,188.5$, currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$ and the actual shares repurchased $ASR$ is $2,600$

$$\begin{align*} EE&=\frac{NIE}{CS-ASR}\\[12pt] &=\frac{26,188.5}{7,400-2,600}\\[12pt] &=\frac{26,188.5}{4,800}\\[12pt] &=5.45 \end{align*}$$

So, the earnings per share under the expansion economic condition is $\boxed{\$5.45}$
​

We have to find out the earnings per share under the recession economic condition which we denote with $ER$, where the net income of recession condition $NIR$ is $\$10,151.5$, currently outstanding shares $CS$ is $7,400$ and the actual shares repurchased $ASR$ is $2,600$

$$\begin{align*} ER&=\frac{NIR}{CS-ASR}\\[12pt] &=\frac{10,151.5}{7,400-2,600}\\[12pt] &=\frac{10,151.5}{4,800}\\[12pt] &=2.11 \end{align*}$$

So, the earnings per share under the recession economic condition is $\boxed{\$2.11}$
​

We have to find out the actual percentage change in earnings per share from nominal to expansion which we denote with $PE$, where the earnings per share of expansion economic $EE$ is $5.45$, and the earnings per share of nominal economic are $EN$ is $4.02$

$$\begin{align*} PE&=\frac{EE-EN}{EN}\\[12pt] &=\frac{5.45-4.02}{4.02}\\[12pt] &=\frac{1.43}{4.02}\\[12pt] &=0.3557\\[7pt] &=35.57\% \end{align*}$$ 
So, the actual percentage change in earnings per share from nominal to expansion is $\boxed{35.57\%}$

We have to find out the actual percentage change in earnings per share from nominal to the recession which we denote with $PR$, where the earnings per share of recession economic $ER$ is $2.11$, and the earnings per share of nominal economic are $EN$ is $4.02$

$$\begin{align*} PR&=\frac{ER-EN}{EN}\\[12pt] &=\frac{2.11-4.02}{4.02}\\[12pt] &=\frac{-1.91}{4.02}\\[12pt] &=-0.4751\\[7pt] &=-47.51\% \end{align*}$$
So, the actual percentage change in earnings per share from nominal to recession is $\boxed{-47.51\%}$
